definition: to push the wave and add to the billows (idiom); to add momentum/to encourage sth to get bigger/to add fuel to the fire
to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
wave/ripple/storm/surge
Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]
to help/to assist
swelling water

sentences.english: The media have also abetted the feeling of unreality.
sentences.chinese: 媒体也在一旁对这种非现实感推波助澜。

sentences.english: Younger said this highly organized underworld courier service is facilitated by corrupt officials.
sentences.chinese: 腐败官员为这个高度有组织的地下贩运业推波助澜。

sentences.english: Globalization has also contributed to the shift, said Zhang.
sentences.chinese: 张教授说，全球化也对这种转变推波助澜。

sentences.english: EASTPO is the bridge connecting machine tool makers and shipbuilding makers.
sentences.chinese: 东博国际机床展为此牵线搭桥，推波助澜。

to have an ulterior motive (idiom)
accomplice/accessory
variant of 幫凶|帮凶[bang1 xiong1]
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
to pour oil on the fire (idiom); fig. to aggravate a situation/to enrage people and make matters worse
to incite disharmony/to instigate
to wave flags and shout battle cries (idiom); to egg sb on/to give support to
to incite/to instigate
to agitate for/to enthusiastically promote
to throw stones at sb who fell down a well (idiom); to hit a person who is down
to suppress/to beat down
to look favorably on sth/would be glad see it happen

to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
to agitate/to arouse/to instigate/to encite
